ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This memory seminar is a fun class that is appropriately challenging and covers interesting material. If you have no interest in memory it is not for you, but the content of the course is pretty broad, so it is likely to peak your interest somehow. I think it is telling that on the last day of the class we all sat around the table an extra moment and kind of collectively sighed, sad that it was over.
Useful introduction to academic research topics in memory.
A seminar discussion of memory drawn from relevant scientific articles in psychology, neurobiology, and cognitive science. A must take if you are interested in the subject!
Great class, I would definitely recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me essential background on a wide variety of topics related to memory. We had to complete weekly "comment papers" that helped me read the material in a useful way - trying to stimulate ideas for future research.
Not directly applicable to my research, but information about memory systems will inform my comprehension literature in the field.
